description: False Saffron Milk Cap has orange cap (4-12 cm) with concentric zones, greenish stains. Gills orange, crowded. Stem orange with pits. KEY: ORANGE LATEX turning GREEN quickly - faster than L. delicious. Like L. deliciosus but under SPRUCE not pine. Flesh pale. Spore print cream.
habitat: Mycorrhizal with SPRUCE (Picea) in Europe and North America. Grows under spruce trees in coniferous forests. Prefers acidic soil.
lookalikes: Lactarius deliciosus - pine host not spruce
Other orange Lactarius - check tree host
safety_notes: EDIBLE: Good flavor, similar to L. deliciosus. ORANGE LATEX turning GREEN + SPRUCE host diagnostic. May stain green when cooked - normal. Best young. Cook thoroughly.
